intro: Castanea sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It produces edible nuts enclosed in a spiny husk, which ripen in the autumn. The plant has palmate leaves with 5–7 leaflets and can grow up to 25 meters tall. It thrives in temperate climates and is often cultivated for its nutritional value and ornamental qualities. The tree plays an important role in both ecological and agricultural systems.
